title: University of Tennessee Photograph and Slide Collection
repository_processing_note: (9 regular boxes, 14 oversize and 2 map drawers)
finding_aid_title: Finding Aid for the University of Tennessee Photograph and Slide Collection

content: This collection houses photographs and slides documenting the University of Tennessee from its beginnings as Blount College in 1794 through the 1990s. Interested researchers may also wish to consult AR.0015: Office of the University Historian's Photograph and Slide Collection, 1820s-1990s.
notes.label: Abstract

subnotes.content: Collections are stored offsite, and a minimum of 24 hours is needed to retrieve these items for use. Researchers interested in consulting any of the collections are advised to contact Special Collections.
The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

[Identification of Item], University of Tennessee Photograph and Slide Collection, AR.0018. University of Tennessee Libraries, Knoxville, Betsey B. Creekmore Special Collections and University Archives.
This artificial collection was compiled from a number of different sources.
There is no biographical information available.

This collection houses photographs and slides documenting the University of Tennessee from its beginnings as Blount College in 1794 through the 1990s. Interested researchers may also wish to consult AR.0015: Office of the University Historian's Photograph and Slide Collection, 1820s-1990s.

Identifying marks and notations are in parentheses.
This collection consists of twenty three boxes divided into nine series:

items: Series I: University Presidents and Trustees
Series III: Students and Student Organizations
Series VI: Other Departments and Services
Series VII: Buildings and Views on Campus
subnotes.title: Missing Title

subnotes.content: Oversized materials were removed to appropriate housing and integrated into the finding aid after initial processing was completed. For detailed listing of oversized items, please see Special Collections staff.
